title: from_10xh5_to_h5mu
description: Converts a 10x h5 into an h5mu file.

Dataset input.title: Dataset input
Dataset input.description: Dataset input using nf-tower "dataset" or "data explorer". Allows for the input of multiple         parameter sets to initialise a Nextflow channel.

param_list.description: Dataset input can either be a list of maps, a csv file, a json file, a yaml file, or simply a yaml                 blob. The names of the input fields (e.g. csv columns, json keys) need to be an exact match with the workflow input parameters.

input.description: Type: `file`, required, example: `raw_feature_bc_matrix.h5`. A 10x h5 file as generated by Cell Ranger
input.help_text: Type: `file`, required, example: `raw_feature_bc_matrix.h5`. A 10x h5 file as generated by Cell Ranger.

input_metrics_summary.description: Type: `file`, example: `metrics_cellranger.h5`. A metrics summary csv file as generated by Cell Ranger
input_metrics_summary.help_text: Type: `file`, example: `metrics_cellranger.h5`. A metrics summary csv file as generated by Cell Ranger.

output.description: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file
output.help_text: Type: `file`, default: `$id.$key.output.h5mu`, example: `output.h5mu`. Output h5mu file.

uns_metrics.help_text: Type: `string`, default: `metrics_cellranger`. Name of the .uns slot under which to QC metrics (if any).

min_genes.description: Type: `integer`, example: `100`. Minimum number of counts required for a cell to pass filtering
min_genes.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `100`. Minimum number of counts required for a cell to pass filtering.

min_counts.description: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. Minimum number of genes expressed required for a cell to pass filtering
min_counts.help_text: Type: `integer`, example: `1000`. Minimum number of genes expressed required for a cell to pass filtering.

nextflow input-output arguments.title: Nextflow input-output arguments
nextflow input-output arguments.description: Input/output parameters for Nextflow itself. Please note that both publishDir and publish_dir are supported but at least one has to be configured.

publish_dir.description: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory
publish_dir.help_text: Type: `string`, required, example: `output/`. Path to an output directory.
